title: Sumset
summary: In additive combinatorics, the sumset (also called the Minkowski sum) of two subsets A {\displaystyle A} and B {\displaystyle B} of an abelian group G {\displaystyle G} (written additively) is defined to be the set of all sums of an element from A {\displaystyle A} with an element from B {\displaystyle B} . That is,
